key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA prices are predominantly higher than Avianca's website, with over 94% cases maintaining this trend despite a slight decline in frequency of higher prices.
MSE offers prices lower than Avianca's site on 23.22% of itineraries, indicating a significant portion of competitive pricing despite slight fluctuations over weeks.
GDS consistently shows a high occurrence of higher-priced offers, with 99.23% of itineraries priced above Avianca's rates, reinforcing its channel's premium nature.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTA prices are higher than Avianca's website in approximately 94% of the cases, trending consistently across weeks and months.
There was a slight decline in the frequency of higher OTA prices from the previous week and previous month comparisons, indicating a slight correction in the price parity between channels.
Only around 2.35% of cases had lower prices on OTAs than Avianca’s site, which remained relatively stable, showing little competitive price pressure externally.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Instances where the website offer was not found on OTA remain consistently low across all dimensions, suggesting no significant distribution gaps.
‘Same price’ incidences showed notable growth—0.36% from the last week, and 0.47% over the month—indicating a shift towards more frequent price matching with Aviana's site.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul routes are priced higher on OTAs, recorded in over 94% of cases, with prices marginally decreasing from prior periods.
Long haul exhibit inconsistencies, with no cases of OTA lower prices reported, highlighting a strong retention of price control on Avianca’s site versus OTAs.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For Colombian-origin routes, OTA higher prices were seen in 93.82% of cases, illustrating steady competitive alignment compared to non-Colombian origins.
Non-Colombian origins display a slight increase in ‘Same price’ incidences reflecting tightening price margins with OTA competitive offerings at a stable 96% higher price frequency.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For 'Close-In' bookings, OTA pricing was higher 92.09% of the time, but with a noticeable trend of frequency decrease by 1.47% from last week.
‘Far-Out’ bookings continue to maintain a 97.64% OTA higher pricing with little shift observed over the monthly comparison suggesting stable strategic positioning.

mse_highlights.line_content: In the latest week, 23.22% of itineraries were cheaper on MSE than on Avianca's website, showing a slight decrease of 0.7% from the previous week but an increase of 1.5% from the previous month.
75.49% of the MSE prices matched Avianca's website prices last week, with a small increase from the previous week. This stability is crucial for maintaining customer trust.
Very few itineraries (0.61%) were more expensive on MSE than Avianca's website last week, indicating competitive pricing control.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: A minor percentage (0.68%) of offers on the website were not found on MSE last week, showing a slight increase from previous periods, indicating minor coordination issues.
Instances where MSE prices were higher remain rare and stable, suggesting effective price monitoring and strategy alignment.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul routes saw a consistent 75.76% of prices matching between MSE and website, reflecting stable operational control.
Long haul routes have an impressive 70.32% match rate, increasing significantly from previous data points, indicating strong pricing alignment with MSE.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Routes originating from Colombia showed a 76.34% similarity of prices between MSE and website, with MSE occasionally offering lower prices.
Non-Colombia routes demonstrated higher variability, with MSE prices lower on 23.52% of occasions, reducing from prior data.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings had 73.19% of prices matching, whereas 25.30% were lower on MSE, highlighting competitive last-minute pricing.
Far-out bookings showed a high match rate of 79.21%, indicating a strong strategic pricing model for advanced sales.

gds_highlights.line_content: The GDS channel shows a high occurrence of higher-priced offers compared to Avianca's website, with 99.23% of the itineraries being priced higher in the latest week.
There is a negligible occurrence of the GDS channel having lower prices than Avianca's website, standing at only 0.03% of itineraries.
Instances where prices are the same as the airline's website are rare, with GDS offering no exact matches in the current dataset.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Instances where Avianca's website offers are not found on the GDS have slightly decreased over the past month, showing a 0.60% reduction.
An increase in higher GDS pricing is noted over the previous month, now encompassing 98.63% of offers, up by 0.60%.

gds_summary_by_region.line_title: Short Haul Dominance in GDS Higher Pricing
gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short Haul has the highest frequency of higher pricing on GDS at 99.49%, reflecting a 0.66% increase over the past month.
Long Haul pricing is typically higher on the GDS, with 94.87% of instances, though changes have been minor at 0.07% for the month.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Flights originating from Colombia predominantly have higher prices on the GDS, with a notable increase to 99.08% this month.
Non-Colombian origins also exhibit high GDS pricing at 96.60%, with a slight upward change of 0.47% over the month.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: GDS prices are higher for close-in bookings 98.86% of the time, with a consistent price increase over the month by 0.10%.
Far-out bookings display the largest increase in GDS higher offers, rising 1.74% compared to the previous month, maintaining a high 98.09% frequency.
